content.question: Which of the following is true of sewage treatment plants in the United States?

choices.label: They release wastewater before solids are removed from the sewage.
They use stormwater runoff to assist in the treatment process.
They are not designed to remove pharmaceutical chemicals from wastewater.
They have largely eliminated cultural eutrophication in Chesapeake Bay.
They release wastewater that is not regulated by the Clean Water Act.

content.answer: They are not designed to remove pharmaceutical chemicals from wastewater.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Describe environmental concepts and processes.
